channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: @chumak_iryna @britinvan @KiarKini @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock Agreed. Normally force is needed to overcome force, yes, but what realistic force of the state will be left after the current misadventures? https://t.co/jZulDklg1Y

@KiarKini @chumak_iryna @britinvan @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock The Russian ‚ÄòFederation‚Äô can fail, but the pieces could still prosper. (Agreed that a failed, but intact, Russia would be a disaster on many levels.) Self-determination is an essential human right. Central management from Moscow has failed _multiple_ times over the centuries.
@KiarKini @chumak_iryna @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock No honor among thieves, right?
@sppeterson @francis_scarr Even a cabal only has so much bandwidth, especially when multiple crises are occurring simultaneously. Normal human limitations apply.

@johngineer @TrentTelenko Vendors have an incentive to over-state capabilities. Militaries have an incentive to under-state capabilities (or to over-state for deterrence, a-la Reagan‚Äôs ‚ÄòSDI‚Äô/‚ÄòStar Wars‚Äô or DPRK and Russia). ü§∑ Actual field performance depends on many factors, and is likely classified.

@bbcanuck23 @TrentTelenko They are single-use small ‚Äòpads‚Äô or bags seen tiled on the perimeter of some tanks. Filled with explosives (a ‚Äòshape charge‚Äô, I imagine, to direct energy outward), they explode when penetrated by a projectile (or jet from an anti-tank ‚ÄòHEAT‚Äô round) to try to deflect the attack.
@TrentTelenko https://t.co/vFJfC3up4j

@PLCount @1twittafae @kevin_cracknell @TheStudyofWar ‚Ä¶ and even those shaded areas may or may not be occupied by any significant force, depending on the day. Due to heavy use of ranged weaponry (‚Äòlong-range fires‚Äô, as the kids say), one would have to shrink nearly all of those borders by some number of kilometers to find troops.

@1twittafae @PLCount @kevin_cracknell @TheStudyofWar ‚Ä¶ that doesn‚Äôt mean Russia controls the other 90%, of course. Some percentage is surely actively contested and not under the exclusive control or either side.

@EntierSpectre @kamilkazani It‚Äôs nice to know that some nations prioritize infrastructure. Since road maintenance (or any maintenance - see also urban trash pickup contracts) isn‚Äôt ‚Äòsexy‚Äô, and since government (and the press) generally don‚Äôt tend to have experience in those fields, graft is seldom noticed.

@UAWeapons In addition, by not sending those expensive electronic modules, the ‚Äòbook cost‚Äô of the transfer was likely reduced, which allowed the USG to instead send additional munitions and supplies within the current approved budget authority.

@Bear_Faced @ClavdiaMinor @sentdefender The compartment where the fire victims were found was not nearly completely flooded, right? As memory serves, there were three(?) major fatal events (the initial explosion, secondary explosions several minutes later (that killed most crew), and only hours later the fire).
@wyoham @lozaning Adding a tiny bit of solder paste flux to the braid might also be worth considering.

@moscow_english @sentdefender It‚Äôs not _that_ small of an area. They‚Äôd all fit in a large-sized harbor. The Black Sea is has a _surface area_ of 168,500 mi¬≤, equal area to a square 410 miles on each side. (i.e. 436,400 km¬≤, equal area to a square 660 km on each side) Also, submarines operate in 3D space.

@Bear_Faced @ClavdiaMinor @sentdefender Yes, but if poor maintenance practices had not lead to that fire (oily bilge water causing self-ignition of chemical oxygen generator cartridges, if I recall correctly), those crew members could have survived until rescued.
